messages.content: You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)?
Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is a Government Scheme that provides crop insurance protection to farmers when notified crops are damaged due to natural calamities.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
When was the scheme launched?
The PMFBY scheme was launched on 18th February 2016 by the honorable Prime Minister of India.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
From which date the revamped PMFBY scheme has come into effect?
The Scheme was revamped in February 2020 and made voluntary for all the farmers for participation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Who are eligible to get benefits under the scheme?
All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers cultivating notified crops in notified areas are eligible for crop insurance.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Who are not eligible to get benefits under the scheme?
Individual farmers not cultivating the notified crops and farmer groups/collectives are not eligible for the benefits under the scheme.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is crop insurance?

Crop insurance is a crucial tool that helps farmers safeguard themselves from financial losses caused by unexpected natural disasters such as hailstorms, droughts, floods, cyclones, heavy rains, diseases, and pests. It provides a safety net for farmers in case of such unforeseen events.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Why farmers should avail crop insurance?

Adverse weather/climatic conditions such as heavy rains, floods, hailstones, cloudbursts, landslide and natural fire etc, can cause significant damage to crops, partially or wholly. It can burden you economically and socially. Therefore, it is imperative to have economic and social security with the help of crop insurance so that you are protected from probable crop loss.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the provisions under PMFBY/RWBCIS to help farmers?

Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) provides crop insurance protection to farmers in case of damage to notified crops due to unexpected natural calamities. Notified crops are those identified by State Governments to be covered under crop insurance. Field crops like cereals, pulses, and oilseeds are covered under PMFBY, while horticulture crops such as fruits and vegetables are covered under the Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS). The scheme offers farmers very low premium rates to participate in the insurance scheme.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Where do I get information about PMFBY/RWBCIS?

You can call on toll-free Krishi Rakshak helpline no 14447 or reach out to the nearest Bank Branch/Banking Correspondent, Primary Agriculture Credit Societies (PACS), Common Service Centre (CSC), representative of the insurance company in your area, or the local agriculture office at District/Block level for information and insurance of notified crops. For more details, you can also visit the National Crop Insurance Portal at www.pmfby.gov.in.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Which category of farmers are eligible to enroll under PMFBY?

All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers cultivating notified crops in notified areas, are eligible for crop insurance. The enrollment has been made voluntary for all farmers, so now farmers can join the scheme as per their willingness.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Which crops are covered under the scheme?

Crops notified by the State Govt in its notification are covered under crops insurance scheme. the State Govt releases this notification at beginning of every season. The scheme includes all food grain, oilseed crops, and annual commercial/annual horticulture crops in both Kharif and Rabi seasons.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the premium rates to be paid by the farmers for enrolment under PMFBY?
The premium rates for enrolment under PMFBY are 2% for Kharif crop, 1.5% for Rabi crops, and up to 5% for horticulture and commercial crops of the sum insured.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the enrollment channels open for a farmer to participate in PMFBY/RWBCIS?

Common Service Centers (CSC) are local access facilities that serve rural and remote locations, providing various government e-services including enrollment for schemes like PMFBY/RWBCIS. You can also enrol through the nearest bank branch, primary agriculture cooperative societies, post office, insurance intermediary, or self-enrollment via the web portal-https://www.pmfby.gov.in/farmerLogin.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Farmers who can enroll in PMFBY/RWBCIS?

Common Service Centers (CSC) are local access facilities that serve rural and remote locations, providing various government e-services including enrollment for schemes like PMFBY/RWBCIS. You can also enrol through the nearest bank branch, primary agriculture cooperative societies, post office, insurance intermediary, or self-enrollment via the web portal-https://www.pmfby.gov.in/farmerLogin.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Can I enroll under PMFBY/RWBCIS if I have savings account/Jan Dhan Account in any bank?
That's correct! All Savings or Jan Dhan Account holding farmers can enroll in the scheme through their respective bank branches.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the role of banks in enrolling the Loanee farmers under PMFBY/RWBCIS?

Banks play a crucial role in enrolling Loanee farmers under PMFBY/RWBCIS by ensuring the enrolment of Loanee and other interested farmers, maintaining proper records, encouraging farmers to join the scheme, and timely data entry on the PMFBY portal. It is important for banks to coordinate effectively to avoid duplication and provide necessary support to the farmers.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Is there any change in the enrolment process to be followed compared to the previous one?
No, there are no changes made by the Central Government or State Government.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the self-declaration  to be submitted to bank by the existing loanee farmer?

To submit a self-declaration to the bank as an existing loanee farmer who does not wish to be enrolled under the scheme, you can do so by providing a written statement to your serving bank branch, at least 7 days before the cut-off date for enrolment for the respective season. If you do not submit this self-declaration, the premium amount for the notified crops will be deducted from your account by the bank.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the cut-off date for enrolment under PMFBY/RWBCIS?
General enrolment cut-offs for Kharif season is 15-31 July and for Rabi season it is 15-30 December. it may vary from state to state depending on crop cultivation cycle.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Which are the documents required for enrolment in crop insurance scheme?

To enrol in the crop insurance scheme, you will need to provide certain mandatory documents. These include your Land Rights Documents such as Record of Right (RoR) and Land Possession Certificate (LPC), an updated Aadhar Card, and your Bank Passbook (First Page with details of bank accounts).
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the supportive documents required?

Along with Mandatory documents the Satte Govt May also specify requirement of Supporting Alternative Documents like: Sowing Certificate (Patwari or Gram Panchayat) or other documents by the State Government;Self-Declaration of the intent to sow the proposed crop or sown crop.Please let me know if you have more questions on the supportive documents required.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the supportive documents required for tenant farmers?

Along with Mandatory document, tenant farmer also required to sumit following supportive documents  : Contract Agreement in case of lease deed and shared crop / No objection certificate issue by land owner. Please let me know if you have more questions on supportive documents required for tenant farmers.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What Service charges farmers need to pay to get enroll under PMFBY/RWBCIS?
Enrolment under PMFBY is absolutely free of charge. Farmers only need to pay their share of the premium amount.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the recent changes made in Revamped PMFBY/RWBCIS for farmer participation?

Under the revamped scheme, farmers can now voluntarily enroll in the Revamped PMFBY/RWBCIS. Loanee farmers who do not wish to be part of the scheme can choose to Opt Out by submitting a self-declaration to their bank branch. Additionally, all Savings or Jan Dhan Account holding farmers are eligible to participate by enrolling through their respective bank branches. It's important for farmers to inform the bank branches if they wish to participate in the scheme while renewing or applying for a Kisan Credit Card. Farmers also have the flexibility to change the insured crop name up to 2 working days before the cut-off date for enrollment. The premium rates for the scheme remain the same as before.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Since when the new changes in PMFBY are applicable?
All the proposed changes are effective from kharif 2020 season.Remember, these changes are aimed at improving the effectiveness of the scheme for farmers across the country.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How sum insured will be calculated after recent changes announced in the scheme?

The sum insured will be calculated based on various options provided to State Governments, such as Scale of Finance determined by District Level Technical Committee, District level value of Notional Average Yield x Minimum Support Price for any district-crop combination, Farmgate price for crops without MSP, and weighted average market price for the previous season. Each district may choose the most suitable method for their specific crop combinations.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Which are the risks covered under PMFBY/RWBCIS?
Prevented Sowing, Mid – Season Adversity, Localized Calamity, Post – Harvest Loss and Widespread Calamity are the risks covered under PMFBY/RWBCIS.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is prevented sowing?

Prevented sowing refers to the situation where more than 75% of the crop in the normal sowing area is affected due to adverse seasonal or weather conditions, leading to the inability to sow, plant, or germinate the crops. In such cases, a claim payment of 25% of the sum assured can be made, subject to the State Government issuing a notification regarding this situation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is mid-season adversity?

Mid-season adversity refers to various challenges that can affect crop production during the growing period, such as drought, floods, pests, diseases, and natural disasters like storms and cyclones. The government provides risk protection against these adversities to support farmers in case their crop production is significantly reduced. The compensation amount is determined based on the extent of the losses incurred by the farmers.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is localized calamity?

Mid-season adversity refers to various challenges that can affect crop production during the growing period, such as drought, floods, pests, diseases, and natural disasters like storms and cyclones. The government provides risk protection against these adversities to support farmers in case their crop production is significantly reduced. The compensation amount is determined based on the extent of the losses incurred by the farmers.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are Post-Harvest Losses?

Post-Harvest Losses refer to the yield loss of crops that are harvested and left in the field for drying for up to 2 weeks after harvesting. This loss is assessed against specific risks like Hailstorm, Cyclone, Cyclonic rains, and Unseasonal rains. If there is a crop loss, the insured farmer should inform the relevant authorities within 72 hours, providing details of the insured crop and affected area. The assessment of loss is done on an individual farm basis.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Do I get an acknowledgement receipt / SMS on enrolment?

Yes, you will receive an acknowledgement receipt with a unique identification number upon successful submission of your application at the CSC centre. Additionally, insurance companies send acknowledgement receipts to loanee farmers through the post office. You will also receive information through SMS on the registered mobile number.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How do I track my application status on PMFBY portal?

After logging into the PMFBY Portal at www.pmfby.gov.in, you can easily track your application status by clicking on the tab "Application Status". Simply enter your application number and captcha, then click to check the status. A new window will display the current status of your application.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is Crop Insurance App?

Crop Insurance App is an android based app developed by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India for facilitating Crop Loss Intimation during Localized Calamities and Post-Harvest Losses. Farmers can also download this app from Google Play Store here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=in.farmguide.farmerapp.central&pcampaignid=web_share
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the usage of the crop Insurance app?

This app provides a comprehensive set of crop insurance services. Farmers can easily download their crop insurance policy, check premium details, report crop losses, and even upload pictures and videos for crop damage assessment.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Where do I get detailed information of the implementing insurance company and which insurance company is operating in my area for this season?

You can find detailed information about the implementing Insurance Company by contacting on toll free krishi Rakshak helpline no 14447 at CSCs, Bank Branches, or by contacting District or Block Level Agriculture Officers. To know which insurance company is operating in your area for this season, you can reach out to the District or Block Level Agriculture Officers. Another way is to check the PMFBY portal https://pmfby.gov.in/  and use the Insurance Premium Calculator on the home page.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is an Insurance Unit?

The Insurance Unit is basically a defined area by the State Government for the implementation of the Scheme. It could be a Village, Village Panchayat, Revenue Circle, Patwar Halka, District, Taluka, or any other equivalent administrative unit.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is an Insurance Unit?

The Insurance Unit is basically a defined area by the State Government for the implementation of the Scheme. It could be a Village, Village Panchayat, Revenue Circle, Patwar Halka, District, Taluka, or any other equivalent administrative unit.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Does the crop insurance premium will directly be debited from my loan account or I have to inform the bank for debiting premium amount from my loan account?
If you have not submitted an Opt out declaration to your serving bank branch at least 7 days before the enrollment cutoff date, then the premium will be directly deducted from your loan account.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How much is the Common Service Centre (CSC)/Village Level Entrepreneur (VLE) charge for enrolment under crop insurance other than premium amount?

The enrolment under PMFBY/RWBICS is completely free for farmers. CSCs/VLEs should not charge any additional amount from farmers other than the premium. If they do, legal or administrative action may be taken against them.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Whom do I approach in the event of natural calamity like Localized Calamities or Post-Harvest Losses?
In the event of Localized Calamities or Post-Harvest Losses, farmers should inform the concerned Bank, Insurance Company, or Agriculture Department within 72 hours of the calamity.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the process for informing incidents of crop losses and obtaining Insurance Claims?

The process for informing incidents of crop losses and obtaining Insurance Claims involves reporting the loss within 72 hours to the Insurance Company, Bank, or State Government Officers. Intimate via crop insurance mobile app or call on toll-free Krishi Rakshak Helpline no 14447. The information is then forwarded to the insurance company for assessment, and the claim payment is made to eligible farmers within 15 days.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the general timeline for settlement of claims by the Insurance Companies?

Insurance Companies are generally expected to settle the claims within 21 days of receiving final actual yield data from the State Govt, as long as the State share of subsidy is released. State Govts should ideally provide final actual yield data within one month of the crop being harvested.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Where do I report my complaint in case of delay in claim settlement?

If you are facing any delays in claim settlement, you can report your complaint through the Krishi Rakshak Helpline and Portal (KRPH). You can call the centralized toll-free number 14447 for assistance with any issues related to PMFBY/RWBCS implementation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the grievance redressal mechanism established under PMFBY/RWBCIS?

The grievance redressal mechanism under PMFBY/RWBCIS involves committees at various levels. Farmers' concerns are first addressed by the District Agriculture Officer within 7 days. If unresolved, the issue is escalated to the District Level Grievance Redressal Committee (DGRC). If further escalation is needed, it can go to the State Level Grievance Redressal Committee (SGRC), which will resolve the issue within 15 days.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What precautions should a farmer take while applying for PMFBY/RWBCIS?

When applying for PMFBY/RWBCIS, farmers should ensure they provide accurate crop and area details, along with correct bank information. Any discrepancies may lead to claim rejection. If a localized calamity or post-harvest loss occurs, farmers must inform their bank or the insurance company within 72 hours.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What are the objectives of PMFBY?

The objectives of PMFBY are to provide insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure due to unforeseen natural calamities, stabilize farmers' income, encourage them to adopt innovative agricultural practices, and ensure the flow of credit to the agriculture sector.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the time limit for reporting crop damage under PMFBY?
Farmers must report crop damage within 72 hours of the occurrence of the event through the PMFBY portal, mobile app, or directly to the insurance company, bank, or local agriculture officer.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Who are the implementing agencies for PMFBY?

The implementing agencies for PMFBY include both public and private insurance companies, selected by the State Government through a bidding process. The list of approved companies can be found on the PMFBY portal.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Can I opt out of PMFBY if I don't want to participate?
Yes, farmers who do not wish to participate in PMFBY can opt out by submitting a written declaration to their bank at least 7 days before the cut-off date for enrollment.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the premium rate for Kharif crops under PMFBY?
The premium rate for Kharif crops under PMFBY is 2% of the sum insured, with the remaining amount subsidized by the government.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the coverage period under PMFBY?
The coverage period under PMFBY starts from sowing and extends until harvesting, including post-harvest losses caused by specified calamities, within two weeks after harvest.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the role of banks in PMFBY?

Banks play a crucial role in PMFBY by facilitating enrollment, collecting premiums from farmers, and ensuring the timely disbursement of insurance claims to farmers' accounts through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How are claims settled under PMFBY?

Claims under PMFBY are settled based on yield data submitted by the State Government. Once the actual yield is compared to the threshold yield, if the actual yield is lower, the insurance claim is processed and paid to the farmer.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What crops are covered under PMFBY?
PMFBY covers a wide range of crops, including food crops (cereals, pulses), oilseeds, and annual commercial or horticultural crops as notified by the State Government for each season.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How are premium subsidies provided under PMFBY?

Under PMFBY, the premium amount is heavily subsidized by the Central and State Governments, with farmers paying only a small percentage (2% for Kharif crops, 1.5% for Rabi crops, and 5% for horticultural crops).
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What happens if a farmer fails to notify crop loss within the stipulated time?
If a farmer fails to notify crop loss within 72 hours, their claim may be rejected. It is crucial to report losses promptly to ensure the eligibility for compensation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Is PMFBY mandatory for all farmers?
PMFBY is mandatory for loanee farmers who have availed agricultural loans. However, for non-loanee farmers, it is a voluntary scheme.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Are tenant farmers eligible for PMFBY?

Yes, tenant farmers and sharecroppers are eligible for PMFBY, provided they cultivate notified crops in the notified areas and submit necessary documentation such as land lease agreements or proof of cultivation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is an Insurance Unit under PMFBY?
An Insurance Unit under PMFBY refers to the area defined by the State Government for the purpose of insurance coverage. It can be a village, gram panchayat, block, or any other administrative unit.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How can I calculate the sum insured for my crops under PMFBY?
The sum insured is calculated based on the scale of finance set by the District Level Technical Committee (DLTC) for each crop, multiplied by the area of land cultivated by the farmer.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What happens if a State Government delays the subsidy for PMFBY?
If the State Government delays the release of the subsidy, the insurance company may delay the processing of claims. However, farmers will not be held responsible for such delays.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the role of Weather-based Crop Insurance Scheme (WBCIS) in PMFBY?

WBCIS is an alternative to PMFBY and provides insurance protection based on predefined weather parameters like rainfall, temperature, and humidity. Farmers can choose either PMFBY or WBCIS based on their preferences.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
What is the maximum area for which a farmer can apply for insurance under PMFBY?

There is no limit on the maximum area that can be insured under PMFBY. However, the farmer must provide accurate details of the area being cultivated, and the insurance will be based on the area declared.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
How are localized calamities like hailstorms covered under PMFBY?
Localized calamities like hailstorms, landslides, and floods are covered under PMFBY. Farmers must report such events within 72 hours to be eligible for compensation.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Is there any special provision for post-harvest losses under PMFBY?
Yes, post-harvest losses due to cyclones, unseasonal rains, and other specified events occurring within 14 days of harvest are covered under PMFBY.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Can farmers with seasonal crops avail PMFBY benefits?
Yes, farmers cultivating seasonal crops notified by the State Government can avail insurance benefits under PMFBY, subject to compliance with scheme guidelines.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Are there any penalties for false claims under PMFBY?
Yes, farmers who submit false or fraudulent claims under PMFBY may face penalties, including cancellation of the claim, recovery of paid amounts, and legal action.
You are the PMFBY chatbot who is an expert in crop insurance.
Can I change my insurance coverage after applying under PMFBY?
No, once the insurance coverage is applied for under PMFBY, it cannot be altered for the same cropping season.
